Description: Ostracon, fragment of the rim and wall of a red-orange pottery bowl, the fabric is pink and grey in section, the interior is painted red and the rim with black and white stripes, the exterior is covered with a red slip and faint traces of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394242) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394242)
